column1: The '''Gamgee Family''' was an old family of [[the Shire]], originally from the village of [[Gamwich]]. [[Samwise Gamgee]] of the [[Fellowship of the Ring
column2: Company of the Ring]] belonged to this family, though his branch was renamed [[Gardner Family
column3: Gardner]] in honour of his replanting of the Shire.<ref name="long">{{App

column1: Gamgee derives from the earlier name ''[[Gammidgy]]'', referring to the village [[Gamwich]] of [[the Shire]].  "Gamgee" is the Anglicized translation of [[Hobbitish]] surname ''[[Galpsi]]''.<ref>{{App

Showing also the rise of the families of Gardner of the Hill and of Fairbairn of the Towers.<ref name="long"/>  The figures after the names are those of birth (and death where that is recorded).  A dashed line indicates marriage.
<div style="overflow-x: scroll; overflow-y: hidden; border: 1px solid #AAAAAA; padding: 3px; background: #EEEEEE;">

column32:
FAS=[[Fastred of Greenholm]]
Fastred and Elanor removed to the [[Westmarch]], a country then newly settled (being a gift of [[Aragorn
column33: King Elessar]]) between the [[Far Downs]] and the [[Tower Hills]].  From them came the ''Fairbairns of the Towers'', [[Warden of Westmarch
column34: Wardens of Westmarch]], who inherited the [[Red Book of Westmarch
column35: Red Book]], and made several copies with various notes and later additions.</ref>

column2: Tolkien]] noted that Gamgee is an uncommon English surname whose origin he did not know. It was also a word for 'cotton-wool', derived from the name of [[Wikipedia:Samson Gamgee
